title: Hanging, "New York Waterfront", 1926–53
medium:
Medium:  silk
Technique: Hand drawn wax resist dyed (batik), plain weave foundation.
markings: Artist's monogram in lower right: LBBH
description:
Horizontal rectangle. View of Manhattan as seen from the East River: boats in foreground, industrial buildings and warehouses in middle ground, tall skyscrapers (two under construction) in background against sky. Clouds of smoke from industrial buildings reach up into sky. Borders of bridges at top, bridges and storage drums at bottom, skeletal buildings left and right. Borders and buildings in bright and dull yellows against olive drab and dull orange sky. River light blue-green. Touches of ivory and light blue. 
Lined with bright blue silk, plain weave.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, "New York Waterfront", 1926–53.
1926–53. Medium:  silk
Technique: Hand drawn wax resist dyed (batik), plain weave foundation.. Gift of Lydia Bush-Brown. 1974-23-6.
